overview: One of the least well-known areas of Britain, we travel to the Cumbrian Coast by means of two different trains. Firstly, we board a North West Regional Railways Express (class 156) which traverses the former Furness Railway via Grange-over-Sands and Ulvertston to Barrow-in-Furness.  There we change to a class 153 for the most scenic section of the route along the coast from Bootle to Maryport, filmed in what can only be described as 100% perfect weather - not a cloud in the sky! Apparently you only get one day a year like that along the coast and we were there!  As signalling expert David Allen says in his script; "this line is a mecca for semaphore signalling enthusiasts".  Filmed in 1997.
tagline: Carnforth to Barrow-in-Furness, Bootle to Maryport
title: The Cumbrian Coast
